explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though "flammable" according to ICSC (2003). Classified into Division 6.1 and Class 8, in accordance with the classification by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN#0154, chlorodinitrobenzene (solid)).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 470degC (ICSC, 2003)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 52.5-63degC (ICSC,1999), test temperature:140degC)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available (melting point: 63degC (alpha type), 56.2degC (beta type) (ICSC, 2003), test temperature: 55degC). No data available (melting point: 52.5degC (gamma Type) (ICSC, 2003)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 55mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 55mg/kg, 90mg/kg and 277.5mg/kg (EU-RAR No.52 (2005)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 250mg/kg representing the lower of the testing data of rat LD50 (dermal route) of 305mg/kg and rabbit LD50 of 250mg/kg (EU-RAR No.52 (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "severe irreversible irritation and corrosion of the skin" in rabbit skin irritation tests (though the results are not those of 4-hour application) (CERI Hazard Data 98-9 (1999)) and the epidemiological evidence of "chemical burn at the site of exposure." Although classified as Category 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety, if further subclassification is needed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "severe eye irritation (severe eye corrosion)" in rabbit eye irritation tests (EU-RAR No.52 (2005)) and the epidemiological evidence of "serious eye irritation and corrosion" (CERI Hazard Data 98-9 (1999)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Cannot be classified due to the insufficiency of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ/somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell genotoxicity tests in vivo (DNA damage tests), no strong positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro, described in EU-RAR No.52 (2005) and NTP DB (Access on February 2006).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as A4 by ACGIH (2005).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004), EU-RAR No.52 (2005) and BUA 127 (1993): The results of rat teratogenicity tests suggest a significant increase in the incidence of heart malformation in fetuses at dosing levels toxic to parental animals.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system, heart, kidney, liver, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, heart, kidney, liver, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "nausea, vomiting, cardiovascular system disorder, nervous system disorder including loss of consciousness and coma" (CERI Hazard Data 98-9 (1999)), "disorientation, excitement, heart failure and coma, severe metabolic acidosis, rhabdomyolysis, hepatic adipose infiltration, renal failure and brain edema, severe respiratory irritation and pulmonary edema" (MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, heart, liver)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "peripheral pulmonary perivenous infiltration and wall thickening" (CERI Hazard Data 98-9 (1999)), "myocardial degeneration, chronic nasal inflammation, moderate liver inflammation" (MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours ErC50=0.033mg/L of the algae (Scenedesmus) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 99.8% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.22 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
